Table of Contents

Class LayerTissueRegion

Namespace
Vts.MonteCarlo.Tissues
Assembly
Vts.dll

Implements ITissueRegion. Defines a layer infinite in extent along x,y-axes and with extent along z-axis given by ZRange.

public class LayerTissueRegion : ITissueRegion, ILayerOpticalPropertyRegion, IOpticalPropertyRegion

ContainsPosition(Position)

This checks which region photon is currently in.
inclusion defined in half-open interval [start,stop) so that continuum of layers do not overlap.

public bool ContainsPosition(Position position)

Parameters

position Position

Position being checked

Returns

bool

True if photon in region, false if not

OnBoundary(Position)

Method to determine if photon on layer boundary. Needed to determine which boundary photon is on when layer region contains inclusion. Errors in Position accommodated for in test.

public bool OnBoundary(Position position)

Parameters

position Position

Position being checked

Returns

bool

True if photon on boundary, false if not

RayIntersectBoundary(Photon, out double)

Method to determine if photon track or ray intersects layer boundary. Note: LayerTissueRegion.RayIntersectBoundary does NOT use photon.S in the calculation so all photons (unless horizontal) intersect the top or bottom of the layer and the returned distance is not infinity (unless horizontal). This is because MonteCarloSimulation uses the distance to the boundary without intersection in its processing. This is different that all other TissueRegions.

public bool RayIntersectBoundary(Photon photon, out double distanceToBoundary)

Parameters

photon Photon

Photon

distanceToBoundary double

return: distance to boundary, actual distance if no intersection

Returns

bool

true if intersection, false otherwise
